meanings.definition: A unit used to measure dipole moment in molecules.
meanings.sent1: The scientist calculated the debye of the molecule to understand its polarity.
meanings.sent2: The debye of the compound indicated its level of electronegativity.
meanings.sent3: The debye of the substance was so high that it danced around the flask!
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was like a debye, pulling everyone towards her infectious energy.
meanings.sent5: The debye of the solution was as clear as day, revealing its chemical properties.

meanings.definition: A unit used to measure the electric dipole moment in a polar molecule.
meanings.sent1: The debye of the water molecule showed its strong polarity.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use the debye to quantify the polarity of various substances.
meanings.sent3: The debye of the polar bear's fur made it stand out in the snow.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a debye effect, attracting everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The debye of the magnet was so powerful, it could move metal from a distance.

meanings.definition: A unit used to measure the electric dipole moment in a polar molecule.
meanings.sent1: The debye of the charged particle indicated its polarity.
meanings.sent2: Measuring the debye of the compound helped determine its structure.
meanings.sent3: The debye of the penguin's beak made it look like a lightning rod!
meanings.sent4: The debye of her words resonated with the audience, sparking a reaction.
meanings.sent5: The debye of the storm cloud was so intense, it crackled with electricity.
